Dear Jennifer Lynn Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member spoke poorly about youth and inappropriately
shared information. Staff member described youth as
promiscuous, liar, and manipulative, etc.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed the Chief Administrator by telephone on 7/29/2024.
The Chief Administrator referred me to Program Manager as he
would be more familiar with the circumstances that were reported
and the status of the outcome of the allegations.
I interviewed Complainant by telephone on 7/29/2024.
Complainant. Complainant stated she was informed of the
allegations by the therapist of Youth A. Complainant clarified the
initial confusion regarding which Child Placing Agency was
responsible for the supervision of Youth A at the time of the
complaint allegations. Complainant reported Guiding Harbor, the
current CPA, took over this program and services effective May 1,
2024. Complainant provided contact information for the Program
Manager who would have additional information regarding the
status of the allegations.
I completed a telephone interview with Program Manager on
9/9/2024. Program Manager stated Staff identified in the
allegation had been disciplined with a suspension effective
7/26/2024, following the report of the allegations. Program
Manager stated Staff's discipline included a suspension until
8/08/2024. Program Manager stated Staff was disciplined for a
violation of the agency's confidentiality policy. On Monday
07/22/2024, a case manager and Staff met with Youth A for a
routine meeting, where Staff spoke very inappropriately and in a
demeaning manner to Youth A. It crossed many professional and
ethical boundaries and had to be shut down. Staff described youth
as promiscuous, liar, and manipulative, etc. Program Manager
stated Staff was subsequently terminated when Staff did not
return following the disciplinary suspension. The reported
termination date was 8/8/2024.
I interviewed MDHHS Worker by telephone on 09/05/2024.
MDHHS Worker reported she had completed her investigation
with no findings. MDHHS Worker provided a copy of her
completed investigation.
No contact information was provided by MDHHS Worker or the
agency for Staff to be reached.
2

Documentation Review:
The completed MDHHS Worker report indicated a safety plan had
been implemented for Youth A and Staff's employment had been
terminated.
Documentation from the agency Human Resources confirmed
Staff last day worked was 7/24/2024 and Staff resigned 8/8/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as Staff was disciplined for
violating the agency's confidentiality policy and eventually
terminated from employment with the agency. The determination
of this violation substantiates Staff was not of responsible
character and suitable to meet the needs of Youth A. The agency
responded timely to the allegations and implemented appropriate
discipline to establish compliance with the termination of Staff's
employment.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
